conclusion: A drives into a group of blocks and determines which blocks it will collide with and where it will eventually stop.
A is positioned to move towards a group of blocks, with yellow blocks being the closest in its path.
A will collide with the yellow block closest to it.
A will stop at the yellow block because it has enough power to move forward and collide with it, but not enough power to move past it.
The collision will cause A to come to a stop due to the deflection effect of the yellow block.
The other blocks in the group will not be affected by the collision as they are not in the direct path of A.
